intro: Spermacoce tenuior var. commersonii, commonly known as the slender false mignonette, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
